DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D Status Metabolism Human Pregnancy
DOC.detailed_description: Rationale Despite mount evidence maternal vitamin D status link pregnancy outcome [ 1,2 ] , impact pregnancy vitamin D metabolism requirement yet clearly define . In addition , although placenta know express component vitamin D metabolic pathway [ 3,4 ] , little known placental vitamin D metabolism . Moreover , although vitamin D know affect bone health nonpregnant state , effect maternal vitamin D status maternal fetal bone health human pregnancy unclear [ 5-7 ] . Therefore , present study seek advance current understanding vitamin D metabolism requirement pregnancy . Objective Research Questions This study aim examine : 1 ) effect pregnancy comprehensive panel blood biomarkers vitamin D status metabolism ; 2 ) role placenta modulate circulate vitamin D metabolites ; 3 ) impact maternal vitamin D status maternal fetal marker bone metabolism . Study Population , Design , Exposure As secondary analysis , study use biological sample obtain pregnant nonpregnant control woman participate 12-wk randomized control trial 2009-2010 feature two dos choline ( i.e. , 480 930 mg choline/d ) ( NCT01127022 ) [ 8 ] . Throughout control feeding period , 26 third-trimester pregnant woman 21 nonpregnant woman ( reproductive group age > 21 ) good health status consume equivalent intake vitamin D ( 511 IU/d ) , calcium ( 1.6 g/d ) phosphorus ( 1.9 g/d ) study diet prenatal multivitamin supplement ( Pregnancy Plus ; Fairhaven Health LLC ) â‰¥ 10 week . Dependent variable : 1 . Blood biomarkers vitamin D metabolism week 0 ( study-baseline ) week 10 ( represent study-end ) 2 . Placental biomarkers vitamin D metabolism delivery 3 . Markers bone metabolism maternal fetal cord blood well maternal urine Ethical consideration The study protocol original RCT approve Institutional Review Board Human Study Participant Use Cornell University Cayuga Medical Center pregnant woman deliver baby . Informed consent obtain participant study entry , original study register clinicaltrials.gov NCT01127022 . For secondary analysis , deidentified data use . Dissemination Findings Findings present study report manuscript submit publication lead medical/nutrition journal appropriate field ( i.e . nutrition , bone , placenta , reproductive physiology ) . In addition , finding present abstract , poster , presentation research conference .
